name: TheAtlantic
text: In quarantine, @amandamull writes, clutter is, in a thousand unexpected ways, a savior. https://t.co/139rEe3btE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to @alexismadrigal update @jameshamblin and @katlwells on the coronavirus numbers — and why the spread of the pandemic seems so random: https://t.co/P39Rn5QLGW

name: TheAtlantic
text: From open-air cafés to drive-in theaters at airports, how might the pandemic transform cities? @YasmeenSerhan considers the possibilities: https://t.co/7hM5XlJEoQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Films like "Do the Right Thing" and "The Spook Who Sat by the Door" frame urban uprisings as just actions against brutality and as catalysts for change. @samshepPhD on movies about American protest: https://t.co/LMEZmfERsG

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Once the country has an improved idea about what policing is for, then begins the process of developing evidence-informed policies and practices to carry out that vision," @mearest and Tom R. Tyler write: https://t.co/rljgXcSqE0

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We are now seeing America becoming better than it was," @KoriSchake writes. "This churning, disputatious, and even sometimes violent dynamic is what social change in America looks like." https://t.co/XoN1bzVh0m

name: TheAtlantic
text: "By spurning congressional Democrats’ efforts to dispatch additional aid to state and local governments, McConnell is enabling budgetary crises in city after city," @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/V2UPVY6mD0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Minneapolis marked a breaking point in the Movement for Black Lives. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/Q4osR1Zbza

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: Saudi Arabia is raising VAT to help bridge a budget shortfall. Why is that a big deal? Taxes aren't just about money, they affect an individual's relationship with their government.

Smart piece by @abdallah_fayyad in @TheAtlantic on Riyadh's gamble https://t.co/SiyPvqHhNy

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Read @DanielLombroso on what he learned about extremism by spending four years embedded with the alt-right: "Their racism is woven into the fabric of New York, Washington, D.C., and Paris, just as much as Birmingham, Alabama, or Little Rock, Arkansas." https://t.co/qWVI5lNlF7

name: TheAtlantic
text: For autocratic regimes, raising taxes could put their survival at risk. Yet the pandemic has forced some to bridge budget shortfalls. @abdallah_fayyad looks at Saudi Arabia's tax gamble: https://t.co/nKStH82z1M

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @jdickerson: Adapted from my upcoming book: "Donald trump should have seen the coronavirus pandemic coming. This is not a statement about epidemiology. It’s a statement about the presidency, a job of high-stakes surprises that are complex and overwhelming." https://t.co/NmlW5L2O98

name: TheAtlantic
text: “White nationalists aren’t dumb, or poor. They’re scared of losing power,” writes @daniellombroso, who spent four years embedded with the alt-right. “White Noise,” The Atlantic’s first feature-length documentary, explores the seductive power of extremism:https://t.co/EYHcx4xiJj https://t.co/wUpbhIQF9k

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: This is a film you will want to see. For a preview, read this @DanielLombroso piece on his four years embedded with the alt-right: 
https://t.co/lMK0WUn8nB

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: '@DanielLombroso, a Jewish reporter, spent four years embedded with the alt right. He found hucksterism, dilettantes, and above all, people grappling for a way to make meaning in their lives through white supremacy.

It is incredible, and chilling, work.

https://t.co/7LEuvu4Wgp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Is it safe to sing? Should we be worried about asymptomatic spread? @jameshamblin answers: https://t.co/8KT1m2a2EJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @davidlsims: I talked to Judd Apatow about making serious comedy https://t.co/y7nR3zdzAK

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @abdallah_fayyad: I’m taking a break from protest coverage today. Kind of. Instead, I wrote about *potential* protests, and how they might be triggered by taxes since taxation is inherently empowering.

So here’s a story on Saudi Arabia, taxes, and democracy. Check it out: https://t.co/1Knk8iUlVq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: "Progressives like to believe that racism is an opiate of the ignorant ... [But] white nationalists aren’t dumb, or poor. They’re scared of losing power." A chilling summary from @DanielLombroso about his years reporting from inside the alt-right: https://t.co/ioNZHzdsvp

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: Unbundle the Police.

https://t.co/Q8HwDvOxqz

I wrote about my favorite frame for police reform—and why it makes sense to think of policing as a gnarl of overlapping services and actions that should be disentangled, demilitarized, de-escalated, and diminished.

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: Anxiety is growing in Republican circles that Trump could be heading for a resounding defeat in November. But so is concern that the party will be able to abandon his direction even if he does. Here's why. https://t.co/0IR3rHdnnb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I felt like the movie was somehow destined to be seen right now. It’s about trauma, first responders, how families deal with loss. It’s meant to be funny and emotional and healing," Judd Apatow told @davidlsims of his new film "The King of Staten Island." https://t.co/4eEzmh996P

name: TheAtlantic
text:
A House candidate in Georgia is poised to become the first QAnon believer in Congress.

“To look at QAnon is to see not just a conspiracy theory but the birth of a new religion,” @AdrienneLaF wrote in this month's cover story. https://t.co/063zkbQDow

name: TheAtlantic
text: After being clobbered by the Great Recession, young adults are facing yet another economic downturn. Experts worry that it’s going to lead to an even greater rise in suicides, @olgakhazan reports: https://t.co/Ima9KqkmFI

name: TheAtlantic
text: Annie Lowrey and Adam Harris discuss the future of policing, live at 2 p.m. ET today. https://t.co/BBWGlBuN9v

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch live: Staff writers @AnnieLowrey and @AdamHSays discuss the state of policing in America, how the U.S. system compares with that of other countries, and what changes might be on the horizon. https://t.co/PTc1lUvn23

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JohnGHendy: Amazing work from @DanielLombroso:

"Spencer swears he’ll lead the white-nationalist revolution—until it’s more comfortable for him to move home to live with his wealthy mother in Montana." https://t.co/GsIDUYDVza

name: TheAtlantic
text: @AdamSerwer on the myth of the kindly General Robert E. Lee: “To describe this man as an American hero requires ignoring the immense suffering for which he was personally responsible, both on and off the battlefield.” https://t.co/BAmI5jJciG

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Working for Trump forces officials into impossible choices between respecting the Constitution and norms or following the president. Often ... they manage to avoid one terrible outcome only by effecting a different one," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/GY0MQR85ER

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Biden campaign says Trump's favorite TV network is peddling the Kremlin's lies, @IsaacDovere reports: https://t.co/Wy1LX1O9oD

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @IsaacDovere: NEW from me - Many suspect Russian interests are behind the recordings of Biden in Ukraine that have recently come out. Now Chanel Rion of OAN, Trump’s favorite propaganda station, is telling people she’s got five more unreleased hours  https://t.co/tVAAmXw1aG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Coronavirus: Health Care in Brazil's River Communities—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/HDq80oAIXJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: Around the Lee monument today, black activists make speeches, "while others register people to vote, all under the watchful gaze of a man who was willing to give his life to a cause that sought to prevent this very outcome." https://t.co/q99lnIA4gk

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The mere sight of nine humans, sans masks … [was] a balm for the psyche. Then, I began to care about the characters’ daddy issues, professional anxieties, loveless marriages, and fears of rejection.” @msamywallace on watching the YouTube series “Group”: https://t.co/h9ucRvGXBH
